title: Man City vs Liverpool : Latest team news , predicted lineups and injuries
body_text:
Jeremy Doku produced a masterclass of a performance as Manchester City beat Liverpool 3-0 on Sunday to climb up to second in the table.
Erling Haaland saw a first-half penalty saved by Liverpool goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili before handing City the lead in the 29th minute.
Virgil Van Dijk looked to have levelled it up for Liverpool but the equaliser was ruled out after a VAR check, with Andy Robertson deemed offside.
Nico Gonzalez doubled City’s lead from around 22 yards out just before half time, with his deflected strike hitting Van Dijk before flying into the net.
Doku ran riot on the Liverpool backline all day and was finally rewarded with a goal on 63 minutes, whipping an effort into the far corner for 3-0.
The result means City are now second in the Premier League table, four points behind leaders Arsenal. Here’s how it all unfolded…

Metro @ The Match: Wirtz ghosts again
Analysis from Metro‘s Head of Sport James Goldman after Man City’s 3-0 victory over Liverpool…
Watch out Arsenal
Any suggestion that Mikel Arteta’s previously relentless winning machine would sleepwalk their way to the title was always fanciful prior to this weekend. It is pure folly now after a couple of familiar failings reared their head at the Stadium of Light on Sunday, before City laid down an emphatic marker against Liverpool. City have hunted down the Gunners from less promising positions in the past and although the personnel might be different, Arsenal’s failure to go course and distance in the past is likely to haunt them until they finally get over the line. Nothing about City’s recent form suggests they’re going to give them an easy ride.
City’s wing wizards
While they’ve still got to go some to emulate some of their illustrious predecessors, there’s definitely shades of Riyad Mahrez and Raheem Sterling about the current City widemen. Jeremy Doku gave Conor Bradley an infinitesimally more testing time than Vinicius Jnr in midweek and his electric dribbling style now, more frequently than not, culminates in end product. On the opposite flank, Rayan Cherki’s magnetic first touch and inventiveness neatly complimented the qualities of those around him before he was withdrawn early in the second period.
Nico shows why he’s been called up by England
England’s left-back position is certainly up for grabs given the number of options Thomas Tuchel has experimented with over the course of his tenure. Myles Lewis-Skelly’s relative inactivity for Arsenal has handed an opportunity to Nico O’Reilly and it’s one the City youngster looks primed to take. Tasked with taming Mohamed Salah, the 20-year-old hardly gave Liverpool’s talisman an inch and his poise on the ball, a pre-requisite for any City player in Pep Guardiola’s system, helped his side navigate its way out of several tight spots and spring dangerous attacks.
Wirtz ghosts again
Doku’s improvement this season and man of the match display served as a timely remind that it is still way too soon to write off one of Liverpool’s two headline summer signings, but this was another concerning performance. So infrequent was his involvement in the game that it was difficult to determine the role he had been assigned. Either way, he looks ill at ease with the playmaking responsibilities he has presumably been charged with, no matter which combination of midfielders and forwards Arne Slot selects. Lightweight, indecisive and short on confidence, Wirtz and his manager have major issues to solve.
That’s all from us!

Slot makes worrying title claim
Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has made a worrying claim about the Premier League title race.
Click the link below for the full story…
Van Dijk sends message to Arsenal
Virgil van Dijk insists Liverpool are ‘not going to give up’ on retaining the title and says they are ‘ready’ for a ‘big fight’ with Arsenal and Manchester City for the Premier League trophy.
Neville slams Liverpool star after ‘really worrying’ loss
Click the link below to read what Gary Neville had to say about today’s game…
Liverpool’s worrying season continues
Liverpool have lost five of their 11 matches in the Premier League this season, the most defeats by a reigning champion at this stage of a campaign since Leicester in 2016-17.
Only Chelsea in 2015-16 (six) have ever lost more after 11 games of a Premier League season as reigning champions.
How is the Premier League table looking now?
Man City look to be the main challengers for Arsenal this season, moving up to second and closing the gap to four points.
Liverpool are eighth – below Manchester United – after today’s loss.
Keane rules Liverpool out of the title race
Roy Keane has declared that Liverpool can no longer be considered Premier League title challengers after today’s defeat.
‘You can’t be considering Liverpool for the title,’ the Manchester United legend and football pundit told Sky Sports.
‘That was a sore defeat. But this reminded me of City of old. They were outstanding. They are back in the mix.’
Guardiola hails ‘outstanding’ Doku
Pep Guardiola has heaped praise on Jeremy Doku following the 3-0 win over Liverpool.
‘Do you think I teach him how to dribble openings? This is natural talent,’ Guardiola told the BBC.
‘He had an outstanding game against one of the best full-backs in the Premier League.’
Neville: Man City have sent message to Arsenal
Football pundit Gary Neville has shared his thoughts on today’s result.
‘It was about which of these two clubs were going to emerge as Arsenal’s nearest challengers and could they send a message to the Gunners,’ Neville told Sky Sports.
‘Pep Guardiola, in his 1000th game as a manager, his team and his staff, have done that.
‘It’s a really good day for Guardiola and Man City, but it’s a difficult day for Arne Slot and Liverpool.’
FULL TIME: Man City 3-0 Liverpool
Aaaand there’s the full time whistle! That’s a big old win for Man City, who move up to second in the Premier League table.
Szoboszlai booked!
90+2: Szoboszlai shoves Foden and is also booked.
Jones booked!
90: Yellow card for Liverpool star Jones.
Bradley and Wirtz off
83: Liverpool make their last two changes as Gomez and Chiesa come on for Bradley and Wirtz.
Doku and Mac Allister off
74: Doku is off for City, replaced by Marmoush.
Liverpool bring on Jones for Mac Allister.
How are the statistics looking?
71: Less than 20 minutes of normal time to play. City are well on top.
Doku scores a beauty to make it three!
63: CITY HAVE THREE!
Jeremy Doku has been City’s best player today – by some distance – and he’s finally rewarded with a goal.
He drops his left shoulder, comes inside and curls an unstoppable shot into the top corner. O’Reilly gets the assist.
Man City 3-0 Liverpool.
Chance for Gakpo!
59: Bradley causing problems again… His ball finds Gakpo but the Liverpool star blazes his effort off target.
Still Man City 2-0 Liverpool as we hit the hour mark.
Nico nearly scores an own goal!
57: City got away with one there… Nico almost puts the ball into his own net from Bradley’s cross but it flies over the crossbar.
It remains Man City 2-0 Liverpool.
Kerkez replaces Robertson
56: Liverpool make their first two changes and the first one is at left-back as Kerkez replaces Robertson.
The other is up top as Gakpo comes on for Ekitike.
